episodes.title: Inside the dark world of Elon Musk's empire | Sönke Iwersen interview
episodes.description:
Sönke Iwersen is Head of Investigations at German financial daily Handelsblatt, and co-author of the groundbreaking book "The Tesla Files". In this wide-ranging conversation, Iwersen takes us deep into the shadows of Elon Musk’s empire—unpacking what may be one of the most significant corporate data leaks in recent history.

At the centre of the discussion is the Tesla data leak, a trove of confidential internal documents detailing safety complaints, and internal chaos at one of the world’s most hyped car companies. Iwersen reveals how the files came into his possession, what they revealed about the inner workings of Tesla, and the intense global fallout that followed his reporting.

Beyond the leak, the interview explores Elon Musk’s complex role in global politics—from his influence on U.S. policy and space exploration to his chaotic interventions in geopolitics and his flirtation with authoritarian ideologies. Iwersen also touches on Musk’s volatile personal life, cult-like fanbase, and the growing debate over whether the Tesla CEO is a visionary genius—or a dangerously unaccountable mogul.

This is a must-watch for anyone interested in investigative journalism, the future of electric vehicles, and the murky power dynamics behind Silicon Valley’s most controversial figure.

Like PoliticsJOE? We need your support: 
https://www.patreon.com/PoliticsJOE

episodes.title: I infiltrated England’s far-right, this is how they work | Harry Shukman interview
episodes.description:
Harry Shukman is a journalist who spent a year deep undercover in the UK's most prominent far-right organisation, Britain First.

On the release of his book Year of The Rat, Harry swung by the PoliticsJOE dungeon to run us through what being involved in the extreme right of politics looks like.

Subscribe to our podcast now, or you're a silly goose: 
https://linktr.ee/pubcast

episodes.title: Inside Andrew Tate's Romanian compound | Matt Shea and Jamie Tahsin interview
episodes.description:
Matt Shea and Jamie Tahsin are journalists who spent time in Andrew Tate's home while making a documentary about him, and their new book Clown World documents their time spent with Tate.

During this interview they discuss the Tate brothers' warped view on masculinity, misogyny, and how their toxicity is morphing men's view of the world.

Subscribe to our new podcast now, or you're a silly goose: 
https://linktr.ee/pubcast
